commit_message:
Change os_auth_url to use identity_endpoint in conf template

Current template ceilometer.conf.erb is using auth_uri for os_auth_url
which is not a correct approach. This auth_uri is dedicated to be used
by auth_uri under section [keystone_authtoken]. On the other hand, the
passed in identity_endpoint param is not used. Actually, by comparison
with other cookbooks, identity_endpoint should be used for keystone
identity service connection.

Change-Id: I50c631000efe9c82cd83723c1bf9a7c6ef54556c
Closes-bug: #1479399

commit_message:
Add and delete all roles from cluster in patching

- Addition and deletion of nodes of all roles
present in cluster was added to all patching tests

Change-Id: Ie782a1893b0a8f4186a8523fcbe8fe274a98b40a
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests
(cherry picked from commit c0f16fff09ee192237ded01e3d5dccc828aeeb10)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-27 09:42:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f9753aadf124c299da5d611547c4cdeab41198a8', 'message': 'Update hacking to 0.10.0 or newer

it's not possible to ignore a specific option.

Ignore the new warning F812: "list comprehension redefines ...".

Fix E128 "continuation line under-indented for visual indent" warnings
in bin/ programs.

This change allows to use pbr 1.0 and newer which is required to support
Python 3. Previously, hacking 0.8.1 was used, but hacking 0.8 is
incompatible with pbr 1.0 and newer: hacking 0.8 requires pbr<1.0.

Change-Id: I41d63b9467083d7606ad18aaa398ca7738b27fae

Replace the whitelist of flake8 checks by a blacklist. It allows to
disable a single check, which was not possible before. This new approach
allows to enable new tests more easily and see which checks are
currently disabled.

This change allows to use pbr 1.0 and newer which is required to support
Python 3. Previously, hacking 0.8.1 was used, but hacking 0.8 is
incompatible with pbr 1.0 and newer: hacking 0.8 requires pbr<1.0.

Fix also E251 warnings ("unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter
equals") in tempauth.py, because the check became more strict.

Change-Id: I41d63b9467083d7606ad18aaa398ca7738b27fae
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-28 20:21:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/51590455283e63b3166be9aa0017fbc7e53e3b7f', 'message': 'Update hacking to 0.10.0

Replace the whitelist of flake8 checks (select) with a blacklist
(ignore).  It makes possible to disable a single check, which was not
possible before. This new approach permits to enable new tests more
easily and see which checks are currently disabled.

Only new checks are disabled, this change doesn't run less checks than
before. Currently, many checks are disabled, but following changes will
fix these new warnings.

When the "select" option of flake8 is used in tox.ini, the "ignore"
option is ignored. It is not possible to use "select" and "ignore"
options at the same time. See the code in pep8 (flake8 is based on
pep8):

https://github.com/PyCQA/pep8/blob/d48eef071003952ed0f98445dc3dc6bc29618f9c/pep8.py#L1808

The purpose of flake8 is to enhance the coding style, but also to help
to detect common bugs. Blacklisting checks permits to detect new bugs
when upgrading the tools. For example, new checks were recently added to
help porting code to Python 3.

This change permits to use pbr 1.0 and newer which is required to
support Python 3. Previously, hacking 0.8.1 was used, but hacking 0.8 is
incompatible with pbr 1.0 and newer (hacking 0.8 requires pbr<1.0).

pbr 1.0 is required to use environment markers on requirements to
install dnspython on Python 2 and dnspython3 on Python 3.

Fix also E251 warnings ("unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter
equals") in tempauth.py (instead of disabling the check), because the
check became stricter.

Change-Id: I41d63b9467083d7606ad18aaa398ca7738b27fae
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-29 22:06:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ef0386e0eea6e773032be1cc0b5d907c2115c6a8', 'message': 'Update hacking to 0.10.0

commit_message:
Update hacking to 0.10.0

Replace the whitelist of flake8 checks (select) with a blacklist
(ignore).  It makes possible to disable a single check, which was not
possible before. This new approach permits to enable new tests more
easily and see which checks are currently disabled.

Only new checks are disabled, this change doesn't run less checks than
before. Currently, many checks are disabled, but following changes will
fix these new warnings.

When the "select" option of flake8 is used in tox.ini, the "ignore"
option is ignored. It is not possible to use "select" and "ignore"
options at the same time. See the code in pep8 (flake8 is based on
pep8):

https://github.com/PyCQA/pep8/blob/d48eef071003952ed0f98445dc3dc6bc29618f9c/pep8.py#L1808

The purpose of flake8 is to enhance the coding style, but also to help
to detect common bugs. Blacklisting checks permits to detect new bugs
when upgrading the tools. For example, new checks were recently added to
help porting code to Python 3.

This change permits to use pbr 1.0 and newer which is required to
support Python 3. Previously, hacking 0.8.1 was used, but hacking 0.8 is
incompatible with pbr 1.0 and newer (hacking 0.8 requires pbr<1.0).

pbr 1.0 is required to use environment markers on requirements to
install dnspython on Python 2 and dnspython3 on Python 3.

Change-Id: I41d63b9467083d7606ad18aaa398ca7738b27fae

commit_message:
Tempest tests for Members using testscenarios

1. Moved this test from v2/api to v2/ddt.

2. It tests the create/update member method calls with various
combimations of values for the admin_state_up field of lb,
listener, pool and member.

Change-Id: I22edf551cff8543100ca23cf80532fdd6e01b8ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/36/180436/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testscenarios from neutron_lbaas.tests.tempest.v2.api import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) """ Tests the following operations in the Neutron-LBaaS API using the REST client with various combinations of values for the admin_state_up field of lb, listener, pool and member. create member update member """ class AdminStateTests(testscenarios.TestWithScenarios, base.BaseTestCase): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(AdminStateTests, cls).resource_setup() if not test.is_extension_enabled("lbaas", "network"): msg = "lbaas extension not enabled." raise cls.skipException(msg) network_name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') cls.network = cls.create_network(network_name) cls.subnet = cls.create_subnet(cls.network) cls.tenant_id = cls.subnet.get('tenant_id') cls.subnet_id = cls.subnet.get('id') cls.protocol = 'HTTP' cls.port = 8081 cls.lb_algorithm = 'ROUND_ROBIN' cls.address = '127.0.0.1' @classmethod def resource_setup_load_balancer(cls, admin_state_up_flag): cls.create_lb_kwargs = {'tenant_id': cls.tenant_id, 'vip_subnet_id': cls.subnet_id, 'admin_state_up': admin_state_up_flag} cls.load_balancer = cls._create_active_load_balancer( **cls.create_lb_kwargs) cls.load_balancer_id = cls.load_balancer['id'] @classmethod def resource_setup_listener(cls, admin_state_up_flag): cls.create_listener_kwargs = {'loadbalancer_id': cls.load_balancer_id, 'protocol': cls.protocol, 'protocol_port': cls.port, 'admin_state_up': admin_state_up_flag } cls.listener = cls._create_listener( **cls.create_listener_kwargs) cls.listener_id = cls.listener['id'] @classmethod def resource_setup_pool(cls, admin_state_up_flag): cls.create_pool_kwargs = {'protocol': cls.protocol, 'lb_algorithm': cls.lb_algorithm, 'listener_id': cls.listener_id, 'admin_state_up': admin_state_up_flag } cls.pool = cls._create_pool( **cls.create_pool_kwargs) cls.pool_id = cls.pool['id'] @classmethod def resource_setup_member(cls, admin_state_up_flag): cls.create_member_kwargs = {'address': cls.address, 'protocol_port': cls.port, 'subnet_id': cls.subnet_id, 'admin_state_up': admin_state_up_flag} cls.member = cls._create_member( cls.pool_id, **cls.create_member_kwargs) cls.member_id = cls.member['id'] @classmethod def resource_set_health_monitor(cls, admin_state_up_flag): cls.create_hm_kwargs = {'type': cls.protocol, 'delay': 3, 'max_retries': 10, 'timeout': 5, 'pool_id': cls.pool_id, 'admin_state_up': admin_state_up_flag} cls.health_monitor = cls._create_health_monitor( **cls.create_hm_kwargs) cls.health_monitor_id = cls.health_monitor['id'] @classmethod def resource_cleanup(cls): super(AdminStateTests, cls).resource_cleanup() def check_operating_status(self): statuses = (self.load_balancers_client. get_load_balancer_status_tree (self.load_balancer_id)) load_balancer = statuses['loadbalancer'] listeners = load_balancer['listeners'] pools = listeners[0]['pools'] members = pools[0]['members'] healthmonitor = pools[0]['healthmonitor'] if bool(load_balancer) and self.load_balancer.get('admin_state_up'): self.assertEqual( load_balancer.get('operating_status'), 'ONLINE') if bool(listeners) and self.listener.get('admin_state_up'): self.assertEqual(listeners[0]. get('operating_status'), 'ONLINE') if bool(pools) and self.pool.get('admin_state_up'): self.assertEqual(pools[0]. get('operating_status'), 'ONLINE') if bool(members) and self.member.get('admin_state_up'): self.assertEqual(members[0]. get('operating_status'), 'ONLINE') elif bool(members): self.assertEqual(members[0]. get('operating_status'), 'DISABLED') if (bool(healthmonitor) and self.health_monitor.get('admin_state_up')): self.assertEqual( healthmonitor.get('provisioning_status'), 'ACTIVE') elif bool(healthmonitor): self.assertEqual( healthmonitor.get('provisioning_status'), 'DISABLED') elif bool(pools): self.assertEqual(pools[0]. get('operating_status'), 'DISABLED') if bool(members): self.assertEqual(members[0]. commit_message:
Avoid AttributeError at instance.info_cache.delete

When the instance has no related record in instance_info_caches,
an error has occurred ('NoneType' object has no attribute).
As a result, nova can't delete the instance.
Such an incomplete instance, should be deletable by nova.
So the root cause might be addressed separately, but this
exception should be avoided and logged.

Change-Id: Ie0bba032615d3da06cdd95b221beb37a9b8a377d
Closes-bug: #1436693
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/167905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: instance.info_cache.delete() except AttributeError: LOG.warning("Info cache for instance could not found. " "Ignore.", instance=instance)

subject: VMware: add resource limits for disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 13:32:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a708cbe571cb2e4d1c91db35bb7534b19096b9e8', 'message': "VMware: add resource limits for disk

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:disk_limit - The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed
                    this limit. The unit is number of I/O per second.
 quota:disk_reservation -  Reservation control is used to provide guaranteed
                           allocation in terms of IOPS
 quota:disk_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                          'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:disk_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                          number of shares.
This enables the VMware driver to provide enable CPU allocations
for the running instance.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6797ad3442895cd73f240590286b4ae13986291f

commit_message:
VMware: add resource limits for disk

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:disk_io_limit - The utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed
                       this limit. The unit is number of I/O per second.
 quota:disk_io_reservation -  Reservation control is used to provide guaranteed
                              allocation in terms of IOPS
 quota:disk_io_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                              'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:disk_io_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                              number of shares.
This enables the VMware driver to enable disk allocations
for the running instance.

Please see http://goo.gl/6sHwIA for a detailed explanation of the above.

DocImpact

The is part of the blueprint vmware-limits

Change-Id: I6797ad3442895cd73f240590286b4ae13986291f

commit_message:
Add ability to update volume type public spec

Blueprint: volume-types-public-update
Change-Id: Ib9a6e73b729115346f9af63ad3ff8301de2181ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/62/203462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Ability to update volume type public status =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/volume-types-public-update This proposal is to add the ability to update volume type is_public status. Problem description =================== Currently, the v2 volume type update api doesn't support updating volume type's public status. All volume types created are public by default if not specified, It is not possible to update a existing volume_type is_public status. It is necessary to add updating public status for volume type. Use Cases ========= Suppose the admin created a volume type. And he/she wants to make the volume type not public and add access to specified projects. Proposed change =============== * Modify volume_type update API adding is_public property support. Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- REST API impact --------------- Volume type update change * Update volume type API * V2/<tenant id>/types/volume_type_id * Method: PUT * JSON schema definition for V2:: { "volume_type": { "name": "test_type", "description": "Test volume type", "is_public": "False" # new } } * In the existing update volume type API, add a new parameter "is_public" to allow updating public status for volume type. Security impact --------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Other end user impact --------------------- python-cinderclient needs to be changed to support the modified API. * Update volume type cinder type-update --name <name> --description <description> --is-public <is-public> Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: liyingjun Other contributors: Work Items ---------- 1. API change: * Modify Update Volume Type API. Dependencies ============ Testing ======= New unit tests will be added to test the changed code. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation changes are needed. References ==========

commit_message:
Fix cluster-resize operation param checking in server side

This patch fixes the bug1479586 by setting the default value of variable
desired located in ClusterAction.do_resize to cluster.desired_capacity.

Change-Id: I07b30da201a0a4482fb95770b012f4f0299a322a
Closes-Bug: #1479586

commit_message:
Add a register-zanata-projects.py script and job

Currently, projects in Transifex are set up by hand, which requires
infrastructure members log into its admin interface and add projects.
With Zanata, we can do much better, so add a script that will parse
projects.yaml, and create any projects that are required.

Change-Id: Ic28d5dcfdd471dccbe406955a85dbc6f5d7335d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/36/198236/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # Copyright (c) 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from __future__ import print_function import json import os import yaml from ZanataUtils import IniConfig, ZanataRestService def parse_project_data(): data = yaml.load(open('gerrit/projects.yaml')) return [project['project'].split('/')[1] for project in data if project.get('translate') == True] def is_project_registered(rest_service, project): r = rest_service.query('/rest/projects/p/%s' % project) return r.status_code == 200 def has_master(rest_service, project): r = rest_service.query( '/rest/projects/p/%s/iterations/i/master' % project) return r.status_code == 200 def register_project(rest_service, project): project_data = {u'defaultType': u'Gettext', u'status': u'ACTIVE', u'id': project, u'name': project, u'description': project.title()} r = rest_service.push('/rest/projects/p/%s' % project, project_data) return r.status_code in (200, 201) def register_master_iteration(rest_service, project): iteration = {u'status': u'ACTIVE', u'projectType': u'Gettext', u'id': u'master'} r = rest_service.push( '/rest/projects/p/%s/iterations/i/master' % project, iteration) return r.status_code in (200, 201) def main(): zc = IniConfig(os.path.expanduser('~/.config/zanata.ini')) rest_service = ZanataRestService(zc, content_type='application/json') for project in sorted(parse_project_data()): registered = is_project_registered(rest_service, project) master = False if registered: master = has_master(rest_service, project) if registered and master: print("Project %s is fully configured." % project) continue newly_registered = False if not registered: print("Project %s is not registered." % project) newly_registered = True if register_project(rest_service, project): print("\tProject registered.") else: print("\tFailure registering project.") continue if not master: if not newly_registered: print("Project %s is registered, without master iteration." % project) if register_master_iteration(rest_service, project): print("\tMaster iteration registered.") else: print("\tFailure registering master iteration.") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
make package install safer

The following makes apt-get install quite a bit safer by retrying the
apt-get update should it fail using a common pattern copied from
devstack.

It also keeps track of whether or not we've run the apt-get update
during this run, which means we don't it more than once for no reason.

For the specific case of the python yaml module we also check to see
if it's installed first (which it often is) to avoid doing network
actions when not needed.

This should make the

Related-Bug: #1400905

show up less often

Change-Id: I77159da4e33f4255bd8a5d7d8cd3eaae3a8a59a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/62/207462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function apt_get_install { # fetch the updates in a loop to ensure that we're update to # date. Only do this once per run. Give up to 5 minutes to succeed # here. if [[ -z "$APT_UPDATED" ]]; then if ! timeout 300 sh -c "while ! sudo apt-get update; do sleep 30; done"; then echo "Failed to update apt repos, we're dead now" exit 1 fi APT_UPDATED=1 fi sudo apt-get --assume-yes install $@ }

subject: Change Glance notifications to be create_or_update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-28 22:52:29.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/images_notification_handler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/0d4c8add4373cda4a119a7709fe8299893d171bc', 'message': "Change Glance notifications to be create_or_update

The glance image plugin uses two separate functions for create and update based
on the notification type. Under these functions it is called update on the
elasticsearch client.  This call will fail with a 404 error if the image
doesn't already exist.  The reason for it not existing may be numerous
(Create notifications dropped due to some sort of error, user deletes from
index, etc), but we can not worry about why it may not exist.  Instead this
should do create_or_update like functionality and if the image doesn't exist
on the update call, it should be inserted.

This patch makes use of the elastic search functionality called doc_as_upsert,
which natively provides the type of handling desired as stated above.

Change-Id: Icd97e15ed549b644d6b1aa9d019a8dd0b44defe7
Closes-Bug: #1479138
"}]
commit_message:
Change Glance notifications to be create_or_update

The glance image plugin uses two separate functions for create and update based
on the notification type. Under these functions it is called update on the
elasticsearch client.  This call will fail with a 404 error if the image
doesn't already exist.  The reason for it not existing may be numerous
(Create notifications dropped due to some sort of error, user deletes from
index, etc), but we can not worry about why it may not exist.  Instead this
should do create_or_update like functionality and if the image doesn't exist
on the update call, it should be inserted.

This patch makes use of the elastic search functionality called doc_as_upsert,
which natively provides the type of handling desired as stated above.

Change-Id: Icd97e15ed549b644d6b1aa9d019a8dd0b44defe7
Closes-Bug: #1479138
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/56/206756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "image.create": self.create_or_update, "image.update": self.create_or_update, def create_or_update(self, payload): body = { "doc": payload, "doc_as_upsert": True } body=body,
deleted_lines: "image.create": self.create, "image.update": self.update, def create(self, payload): self.engine.create( index=self.index_name, doc_type=self.document_type, body=payload, id=id ) def update(self, payload): id = payload['id'] payload = self.serialize_notification(payload) doc = {"doc": payload} body=doc,

commit_message:
VMware: store extra_specs object

Maintain the extra_specs object on the VI data structure. This
will enable us to configure the disk limits.

The is part of the blueprint vmware-limits

Change-Id: I837fec1a7ee77e4a260e0d68672b5495b6837285

deleted_lines: image_info, extra_specs.storage_policy) image_info, extra_specs.storage_policy) self._instance, image_info, extra_specs.storage_policy) self._instance, image_info) vi = self._vmops._get_vm_config_info(self._instance, image_info)

commit_message:
VMware: Resource limits for memory

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:memory_limit - The utilization of a virtual machine will
                      not exceed this limit, even if there are available
                      resources. This is typically used to ensure a
                      consistent performance of virtual machines
                      independent of available resources.
                      Units are MB.
 quota:memory_reservation -  guaranteed minimum reservation (MB)
 quota:memory_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                             'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:memory_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                             number of shares.

Please see http://goo.gl/uepivS for an explanation of the above.

DocImpact

This is part of the blueprint vmware-limits

Change-Id: Idc77841768fae5f03cc88d6b6485b9c5056fe137
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/179060/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: storage_policy=None, memory_limits=None): if memory_limits is None: memory_limits = Limits() self.memory_limits = memory_limits # Configure memory information if extra_specs.memory_limits.has_limits(): config_spec.memoryAllocation = _get_allocation_info( client_factory, extra_specs.memory_limits, 'ns0:ResourceAllocationInfo')

commit_message:
VMware: create common object for limits, reservations and shares

Currently we are supporting cpu limits, reservations and shares.
The same are also supported for disks, memory and vnics.

This patch creates a common data structure to be used to support all
of the above.

This is part of the blueprint vmware-limits

Change-Id: I0abf816a6e3b29f10f7380a5865d30e887c09766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/179059/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Limits(object): def __init__(self, limit=None, reservation=None, shares_level=None, shares_share=None): """imits object holds instance limits for convenience.""" self.limit = limit self.reservation = reservation self.shares_level = shares_level self.shares_share = shares_share if self.shares_level in ('high', 'normal', 'low'): if self.shares_share: "configured") % self.shares_level if self.shares_level == 'custom': if self.shares_level: reason = _("Share '%s' is not supported") % self.shares_level def has_limits(self): return bool(self.limit or self.reservation or self.shares_level) cpu_limits = Limits()def _get_allocation_info(client_factory, limits, allocation_type): allocation = client_factory.create(allocation_type) if limits.limit: allocation.limit = limits.limit if limits.reservation: allocation.reservation = limits.reservation if limits.shares_level: shares.level = limits.shares_level limits.shares_share): shares.shares = limits.shares_share if extra_specs.cpu_limits.has_limits(): config_spec.cpuAllocation = _get_allocation_info( client_factory, extra_specs.cpu_limits, 'ns0:ResourceAllocationInfo') resize_spec.cpuAllocation = _get_allocation_info( client_factory, extra_specs.cpu_limits, 'ns0:ResourceAllocationInfo')
deleted_lines: class CpuLimits(object): def __init__(self, cpu_limit=None, cpu_reservation=None, cpu_shares_level=None, cpu_shares_share=None): """CpuLimits object holds instance cpu limits for convenience.""" self.cpu_limit = cpu_limit self.cpu_reservation = cpu_reservation self.cpu_shares_level = cpu_shares_level self.cpu_shares_share = cpu_shares_share if self.cpu_shares_level in ('high', 'normal', 'low'): if self.cpu_shares_share: "configured") % self.cpu_shares_level if self.cpu_shares_level == 'custom': if self.cpu_shares_level: reason = _("Share '%s' is not supported") % self.cpu_shares_level cpu_limits = CpuLimits() def has_cpu_limits(self): return bool(self.cpu_limits.cpu_limit or self.cpu_limits.cpu_reservation or self.cpu_limits.cpu_shares_level) def _get_allocation_info(client_factory, extra_specs): allocation = client_factory.create('ns0:ResourceAllocationInfo') if extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_limit: allocation.limit = extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_limit if extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_reservation: allocation.reservation = extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_reservation if extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_shares_level: shares.level = extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_shares_level extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_shares_share): shares.shares = extra_specs.cpu_limits.cpu_shares_share if extra_specs.has_cpu_limits(): config_spec.cpuAllocation = _get_allocation_info(client_factory, extra_specs) resize_spec.cpuAllocation = _get_allocation_info(client_factory, extra_specs)

subject: VMware: add support for cores per socket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-03 10:58:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f9480376732936186d804b277a490dda67020df2', 'message': "VMware: add support for cores per socket

The VM config spec enables the called to define the number of cores
per socket.

This is the number of cores among which to distribute CPUs in this
virtual machine.

The cores per socket can be configured per flavor extra specs via:
'vmware:cores_per_socket' or specifically per image metadata via
'vmware_cores_per_socket'.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I14df8e78969835ab28b579d61415c98c55a736f8
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-03 12:15:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fb28397f056b5fca7a9879a9f9d214f2f2d549e6', 'message': "VMware: add support for cores per socket

The VM config spec enables the called to define the number of cores
per socket.

commit_message:
VMware: add support for cores per socket

The VM config spec enables the caller to define the number of cores
per socket.

This is the number of cores among which to distribute CPUs in this
virtual machine.

The cores per socket can be configured per flavor extra specs via:
'hw:cpu_sockets' or specifically per image metadata via
'hw_cpu_sockets'.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I14df8e78969835ab28b579d61415c98c55a736f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/187942/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add l3 service stub file

This change introduces the bare minimum of changes to make
routers and floating ip handling from an l3 service configurable,
*NOT* functional. It is just a stub file.

Partially Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-ml2

Change-Id: I745b6c370adfcf5d0412879393f604bcce941e9e
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/08/207308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disable lagency launch when LAUNCH_INSTANCE_LEGACY_ENABLED is False

The network topology page doesn't honor LAUNCH_INSTANCE_LEGACY_ENABLED,
even when LAUNCH_INSTANCE_LEGACY_ENABLED is set to false, the lagency
launch wizard is still shown.

Change-Id: I30167e28cee174da5b2cdfe41edff4e3f375d88e
Closes-bug: #1478710

commit_message:
Cache Keystone client instance

For large deployments Ironic drivers can generate many requests to
Keystone. But Keystone service catalog and auth token can be cached,
(they stored in the client instance).
This patch adds caching for Keystone client instance.

Change-Id: I8ad5a958afc858f8e2f150466615db382950a500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/85/186685/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE = (None, 0) @mock.patch('keystoneclient.v2_0.client.Client', autospec=True) def test_cache_client_init(self, mock_ks): fake_client = FakeClient() mock_ks.return_value = fake_client with mock.patch.object(time, 'time', lambda: 777.0): keystone._get_ksclient() cached_client, client_time = keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE self.assertEqual(fake_client, cached_client) self.assertEqual(777.0, client_time) self.assertEqual(1, mock_ks.call_count) @mock.patch('keystoneclient.v2_0.client.Client', autospec=True) def test_cache_client_cached(self, mock_ks): self.config(group='keystone', cache_time=100) fake_client = FakeClient() current_time = time.time() keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE = (fake_client, current_time) new_current_time = current_time + 50 with mock.patch.object(time, 'time', lambda: new_current_time): self.assertEqual(fake_client, keystone._get_ksclient()) self.assertEqual(current_time, keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE[1]) self.assertFalse(mock_ks.called) @mock.patch('keystoneclient.v2_0.client.Client', autospec=True) def test_cache_client_expired(self, mock_ks): self.config(group='keystone', cache_time=100) fake_client = FakeClient() current_time = time.time() keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE = (fake_client, current_time) fake_client1 = FakeClient() mock_ks.return_value = fake_client1 new_current_time = current_time + 150 with mock.patch.object(time, 'time', lambda: new_current_time): self.assertEqual(fake_client1, keystone._get_ksclient()) self.assertEqual(new_current_time, keystone._KS_CLIENT_CACHE[1]) self.assertEqual(1, mock_ks.call_count)

commit_message:
Allow ramdisk_id, kernel_id to be null on schema

Since is possible to create images with no
ramdisk_id, kernel_id parameters on glance v1,
then the schema-image.json needs to be modified to
allow null, string values for both attributes
and prevent LP #1447193 to happen with a glance v2
client.

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1447215
Related-Bug: #1447193

Change-Id: I645c797553ccaa84062f9ad28f2349ae738a0c96
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit 82c63b1df4399db22dfd71e3326a6bfc1b372a9c)

commit_message:
Move hook-{name}-rtfd to proposal node

Our RTFD hook just does a curl request to upstream. As such, it is
very expensive to nodepool to build a node for the purpose of just
using curl.

Lets move the job to use the proposal node which is long living.

Change-Id: I8f407fdaeb890a4ae6a9b99caefe836b8f2f7819
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.

This patch fix this problem.

Change-Id: I09ba728fd457b96589dd9246e55fb311f677b3dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/91/194991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add APIs for deleting logical router port

Add APIs to delete logical router port.  Also adjust
the add logical port API since the OVN_Northbound schema
now supports the 'name' field.

added_lines: def __init__(self, api, name, lrouter, lswitch, may_exist, **columns): self.name = name lrouter_port.name = self.name class DelLRouterPortCommand(BaseCommand): def __init__(self, api, name, lrouter, lswitch, if_exists): super(DelLRouterPortCommand, self).__init__(api) self.name = name self.lrouter = lrouter self.lswitch = lswitch self.if_exists = if_exists def run_idl(self, txn): try: lrouter = idlutils.row_by_value(self.api.idl, 'Logical_Router', 'name', self.lrouter) lswitch = idlutils.row_by_value(self.api.idl, 'Logical_Switch', 'name', self.lswitch) lrouter_ports = getattr(lrouter, 'ports', []) lrouter_port = idlutils.row_by_value(self.api.idl, 'Logical_Router_Port', 'name', self.name) except idlutils.RowNotFound: if self.if_exists: return msg = _("Logical Router Port %s does not exist") % self.name LOG.error(msg) raise RuntimeError(msg) new_ports = [] for port in lrouter_ports: if port is not lrouter_port: new_ports.append(port) setattr(lrouter, 'ports', new_ports) setattr(lswitch, 'router_port', [])

commit_message:
distributed coordinated notifications

this patch enables a queue per pipeline per agent. each agent can
send data to pipeline queue set of any agent but only listens to it's
own pipeline queue. when receiving a notification, the agent will:
1. build datapoint
2. calculate hash key based on (hardcoded) attribute and mod hash
   by number of active agents
3. sends the data to single agents pipeline queue set.

ex. two agents, sample1 with res_id=1 and sample2 with res_id=2
1. agent1 builds both samples
2. hash(sample1) % 2 (num agents) == agent1 sends sample to agent2
   pipeline queue.
2a. agent2 process sample1
3. hash(sample2) % 2 (num agents) == agent1 sends sample to agent1
   pipeline queue.
3a. agent1 process sample2

Implements blueprint distributed-coordinated-notifications

Change-Id: Iab52cae0a5bfbc747a2918e67dfe8da5fd0fda84

"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"}, "timestamp": time.time()*1000, "value": 1.0, "value_meta": { "key1": "value1", "key2": "value2" } } response = do_request("POST", "/metrics", body) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = metric_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) def test_metric_name_list(): response = do_request("GET", "/metrics/names") verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = metric_name_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) def "name": "name1", "start_time": one_hour_ago.isoformat()+'Z', } query_str = urllib.urlencode(query_params) response = do_request("GET", "/metrics/measurements?"+query_str) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = measurement_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) def test_statistics_get(): one_hour_ago = datetime.datetime.utcnow()-datetime.timedelta(minutes=1) one_hour_ago = one_hour_ago - datetime.timedelta(microseconds= one_hour_ago.microsecond) query_params = { "name": "name1", "start_time": one_hour_ago.isoformat()+'Z', "statistics": "count,max,min,avg" } query_str = urllib.urlencode(query_params) response = do_request("GET", "/metrics/statistics?"+query_str) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = statistics_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) def test_notification_CRUD(): # define a random name to reduce chances of collision notif_name = "Test_api_func_{}".format(random.randint(1, 1000000)) body = { "name": notif_name, "type": "WEBHOOK", "address": "http://somesite.com" } response = do_request("POST", "/notification-methods", body) verify_response_code(response, 201) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, notification_schema) message = "Name was {}, expected {}" assert json_data['name'] == body['name'], message.format(json_data['name'], body['name']) notification_id = json_data['id'] response = do_request("GET", "/notification-methods") verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = notification_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) response = do_request("GET", "/notification-methods/"+notification_id) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, notification_schema) assert json_data['id'] == notification_id body = { "name": notif_name, "type": "EMAIL", "address": "someone@somewhere.com" } response = do_request("PUT", "/notification-methods/"+notification_id, body) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, notification_schema) message = "Type was {}, expected {}" assert json_data['type'] == body['type'], message.format(json_data['type'], body['type']) response = do_request("DELETE", "/notification-methods/"+notification_id) verify_response_code(response, 204) # test alarm definitions def test_alarm_definition_CRUD(): # define a random name to reduce chances of collision def_name = "Test_api_func_{}".format(random.randint(1, 1000000)) # create body = { "name": def_name, "expression": "test_api_function > 0", "match_by": [ "test-dim" ] } response = do_request("POST", "/alarm-definitions", body) verify_response_code(response, 201) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_definition_schema) definition_id = json_data['id'] response = do_request("GET", "/alarm-definitions") verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = alarm_definition_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) # list response = do_request("GET", "/alarm-definitions/"+definition_id) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_definition_schema) # update body = { "name": def_name, "expression": "test_api_function > 0", "match_by": [ "test-dim" ], "actions_enabled": True } response = do_request("PUT", "/alarm-definitions/"+definition_id, body) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_definition_schema) # patch body = { "name": def_name, "severity": "HIGH" } response = do_request("PATCH", "/alarm-definitions/"+definition_id, body) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_definition_schema) # delete response = do_request("DELETE", "/alarm-definitions/"+definition_id) verify_response_code(response, 204) def test_alarm_state_history_list(): response = do_request("GET", "/alarms/state-history") verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = alarm_history_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) def test_alarm_list_get_update_delete(): # alarm list response = do_request("GET", "/alarms") verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) list_schema['properties']['elements']['items'] = alarm_schema validate(json_data, list_schema) alarm_id = json_data['elements'][0]['id'] # alarm update body = { "state": "ALARM", "lifecycle_state": "open", "link": "http://somesite.com" } response = do_request("PUT", "/alarms/"+alarm_id, body) verify_response_code(response, 200) response = do_request("GET", "/alarms/"+alarm_id) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_schema) assert json_data['state'] == "ALARM" assert json_data['lifecycle_state'] == "open" assert json_data['link'] == "http://somesite.com" # alarm patch body = { "state": "OK", "lifecycle_state": "closed" } response = do_request("PATCH", "/alarms/"+alarm_id, body) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_schema) assert json_data['lifecycle_state'] == "closed" response = do_request("GET", "/alarms/"+alarm_id) verify_response_code(response, 200) json_data = json.loads(response.text) validate(json_data, alarm_schema) assert json_data['lifecycle_state'] == "closed" assert json_data['link'] == "http://somesite.com" # alarm delete response = do_request("DELETE", "/alarms/"+alarm_id) verify_response_code(response, 204) response = do_request("GET", "/alarms/"+alarm_id) verify_response_code(response, 404) def main(): test_version_list() test_version_get() test_notification_CRUD() test_metric_post() test_metric_post_array() test_metric_post_value_meta() test_metric_list() test_metric_name_list() test_measurement_list() test_statistics_get() test_alarm_definition_CRUD() test_alarm_state_history_list() test_alarm_list_get_update_delete() print("pass") if __name__ == "__main__": main()

commit_message:
Remove error_suppression_interval, error_suppression_limit options.

These two options is belong to proxy-server, not account-replicator.

Change-Id: Ie030ecffd213e56db32df77c69b847479d96308f

commit_message:
swiftclient: add short options to help message

- add usage strings for short option such as '-a' for '--all'
  This add all short options  to usage text.
- add missing --header usage help for download command
- some cometic changes

Closes-bug: #1475511

Change-Id: Ibfecac8764669540fa025787548133a50fa50b10
Signed-off-by: Hiroshi Miura <miurahr@nttdata.co.jp>

commit_message:
Swift documentation for first-time contributors.

In this change, there are proposed improvement to Swift documentation aimed at
first-time contributors. They include a simplification of the Getting
Started page and a new page with some basic instructions/commands that the
first-time contributor should know. In addition, it shows some common errors
that the first-time contributor may find when executing git rebase and
information on how to track your changes.

Change-Id: I704202955093736b2f3b4102a649690a0392c6b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/61/206861/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================== First Contribution to Swift =========================== ------------- Getting Swift ------------- Swift's source code is hosted on github and managed with git. The current trunk can be checked out like this: ``git clone https://github.com/openstack/swift.git`` This will clone the Swift repository under your account. A source tarball for the latest release of Swift is available on the `launchpad project page <https://launchpad.net/swift>`_. Prebuilt packages for Ubuntu and RHEL variants are available. * `Swift Ubuntu Packages <https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/swift>`_ * `Swift RDO Packages <https://openstack.redhat.com/Repositories>`_ -------------------- Source Control Setup -------------------- Swift uses `git` for source control. The OpenStack `Developer's Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html>`_ describes the steps for setting up Git and all the necessary accounts for contributing code to Swift. ---------------- Changes to Swift ---------------- Once you have the source code and source control set up, you can make your changes to Swift. ------- Testing ------- The `Development Guidelines <development_guidelines>`_ describes the testing requirements before submitting Swift code. In summary, you can execute tox from the swift home directory (where you checked out the source code): ``tox`` Tox will present all tests results. Notice that in the beginning, it is very common to break many coding style guidelines. ---------------------------- Checking in changes to Swift ---------------------------- The OpenStack `Developer's Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html>`_ describes the most common `git` commands that you will need. Following is a list of the commands that you need to know for your first contribution to Swift: To clone a copy of Swift: ``git clone https://github.com/openstack/swift.git`` To create your development branch (substitute branch_name for a name of your choice: ``git checkout -b <branch_name>`` To check the files that have been updated in your branch: ``git status`` Assuming you have not added new files, you commit your changes using: ``git commit -a`` When you are ready to send your changes for review: ``git review`` If you need to make further changes, you can commit them using: ``git commit -a --amend`` This will commit the changes under the same set of changes you issued earlier. Notice that in order to send your latest version for review, you will still need to call: ``git review`` Note: You may run into the following error when starting Swift if you rebase your commit using: ``git rebase`` .. code-block:: python Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/bin/swift-init", line 5, in <module> from pkg_resources import require File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 2749, in <module> working_set = WorkingSet._build_master() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 446, in _build_master return cls._build_from_requirements(__requires__) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 459, in _build_from_requirements dists = ws.resolve(reqs, Environment()) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 628, in resolve raise DistributionNotFound(req) pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: swift==2.3.1.devXXX (where XXX represents a dev version of Swift). This happens because `git rebase` will retrieve code for a different version of Swift in the development stream, but the start scripts under `/usr/local/bin` have not been updated. The solution is to execute the following command from every .git directory under your swift user (that is, every directory that contains `setup.py`): ``sudo python setup.py develop``

commit_message:
fix gnocchi resources yaml

add missing meters and fix incorrect mappings.

Change-Id: I2ae7a3dcb6571cf84d2070dc2bc2ff819649feec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/35/206235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Keep dns nameserver order consistency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 14:31:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f1049063ec32ed9d8705cc2a2492b4d8bcee4dbd', 'message': 'Add dns server prioritization for subnet

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron. Generally speaking, it is useful that dns servers
has prioritization.

Change option "dns-server" in dnsmasq process when update a subnet's
dns nameserver. By doing this, it is can change dns server prioritization
for subnet.

Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-10 07:04:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e59b6c53261fe11c5f4d7325b47112d45ea49e00', 'message': "Add dns server prioritization for subnet

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron. Generally speaking, it is useful that dns servers
has prioritization.

Add new attribute named 'major_dns_nameserver' to subnet.
So we can point a major dns nameserver when create a subnet which
has dns nameserver. We can also update major dnsnameserver if
the major dns nameserver in old dns nameservers.

Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-11 01:05:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/97267ac1d2abe79b7a2ca9057e48d81bbaa44b58', 'message': 'Add dns server prioritization for subnet

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron. Generally speaking, it is useful that dns servers
has prioritization.

Add new attribute named 'primary_dns_nameserver' to subnet.
So we can primary a major dns nameserver when create a subnet which
has dns nameserver. We can also update major dnsnameserver if
the primary dns nameserver in old dns nameservers.

VM get IP address and get dns info from dnsmasq process, and dnsmasq
has a file named opts which include DNS infos. Just like this:
"dns-server,1.2.3.4,8.8.8.8,114.114.114.114". If we want to change
DNS prioritization we need to change the IP address's order. VM's
resolv.conf will change nameserver orders after we do this.

Close-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1218629
Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-11 01:14:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7e6de0051f0b5eed632ac8502c78c37775994cd8', 'message': 'Add dns server prioritization for subnet

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron. Generally speaking, it is useful that dns servers
has prioritization.

Add new attribute named 'primary_dns_nameserver' to subnet.
So we can primary a major dns nameserver when create a subnet which
has dns nameserver. We can also update major dnsnameserver if
the primary dns nameserver in old dns nameservers.

VM get IP address and get dns info from dnsmasq process, and dnsmasq
has a file named opts which include DNS infos. Just like this:
"dns-server,1.2.3.4,8.8.8.8,114.114.114.114". If we want to change
DNS prioritization we need to change the IP address's order. VM's
resolv.conf will change nameserver orders after we do this.

Close-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1218629
Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-13 14:06:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fc12b0384f9a1762394551740353e3e0d63430f1', 'message': "Add dns server prioritization for subnet

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron. Generally speaking, it is useful that dns servers
has prioritization.

Add a new column named 'order' in table 'dnsnameservers' and
add nameserver into DB one by one.

Close-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1218629
Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-13 14:10:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/59fb816a5d03079356aea1e30a8fcee1e4f0e46d', 'message': "Add dns server prioritization for subnet

commit_message:
Keep dns nameserver order consistency

Currently, there is no dns servers prioritization for subnets
for Neutron.

Generally speaking, it is useful to keep the order of dns
nameservers consistent. Add a new column named 'order' in table
'dnsnameservers' and add nameserver into DB one by one.

Closes-Bug: #1218629
Implements: blueprint keep-dns-nameserver-orderconsistency
Change-Id: Id937aea411397d39370368a4eb45be26c4eefa9e

commit_message:
Replace nosetests with pytest

Now we use pytests in fuel-web and nosetests in python-fuelclient, so it's
better to choose one of them and pytest more preferable choice. Same framework
for stackforge python projects gives us more unified ecosystem for testing and
also it's easier to support only one.

Closes-Bug: #1471815
Change-Id: I786bc966572a3e022592a40a3b61596a6c264e54

commit_message:
SSH Storage
In order to give flexibility Freezer needs to be able
to store data to a remote file system host using ssh/scp
instead instead of Swift.

Change-Id: Ia6a790e3e3b6bb9e4e36d457ba0b72c114f8a895
Implements: blueprint ssh-media

commit_message:
remove conntrackd package

As per bug discussion, conntrackd is actually not needed for netfilter
framework, and given that users do not appear to find the logs useful
(the only reason we're using conntrackd), let's just remove it.

This commit also defines a variable container_remove_packages so that
the list of packages to remove from containers can be added to in the
future.

NOTE: removing conntrackd does not unload the kernel conntrack modules
or disable the netfilter conntrack framework. It simply means we are not
gathering ostensibly useless logging. The kernel conntrack flows can
still be interrogated with the 'conntrack' userspace cli tool, for real
time debugging.

Change-Id: Ic74e65a6fe27060dc94bfc2f250cd53fb153c7c8
Closes-Bug: 1457196
(cherry picked from commit 0da48344c6bdff988473da1aa7e9e0f6ef724680)

commit_message:
Configure incorrect cron file name

OpenStack install OpenSUSE 13.2 indicates incorrect cron file name.
Cron file name is below change.

Original:
/etc/cron.hourly/keystone

Changed:
/etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone.

Source File: /doc/install-guide/section_keystone-install.xml

Change-Id: I6f27b0f67038b0446adae8f791416b72269a9978
Closes-Bug: #1475703
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/88/203188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <filename>/etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone</filename>, so it is not necessary

commit_message:
Warn user about unsupported content type

Raise exception to user when the specified content type is unsupported, instead
of sliently replacing it to default type 'application/json'.

Change-Id: I57dac2dca743d128fbc27dfb4c836885f69e3fae
Closes-Bug: #1480036
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/05/207705/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Raise InvalidContentType exception if we don't find a preference if not bm: raise exceptions.UnsupportedContentType(content_type=self.accept) return bm except exceptions.UnsupportedContentType as e: return webob.exc.HTTPUnsupportedMediaType(explanation=str(e))
deleted_lines: default_accept_type = 'application/json' Defaults to default_accept_type if we don't find a preference return bm or self.default_accept_type

commit_message:
Address some cosmetic issues on the dashboard

 - Redirect to the service page after creating a group
 - Strip trailing 0s from the quote price in instance creation modal
 - Harmonize panels order in the hashmap dashboard

Change-Id: Ib18608da0a95f8e17f9eecf28a032d6f1bae4ea3

commit_message:
Fixup v2 API Validation

* Added list type checking to recordset.records
* Added list type checking to domain.masters
* Added extra debug output
* Catch all Exception clause in objects.adaptors.base.parse()

commit_message:
[WIP] [install-guide] remove unnecessary syntax highlighting

There are a lot of programlistings using syntax highlighting where it
does not makes sense, resulting in a lot of wrong, incosistent, and/or
incomplete highlights in the generated programlistings.

Change-Id: I9781ce2218d3fd8bd9c9f55d54a9c5cdd66ec71d

subject: Fix slow unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-28 18:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/test_service_instance.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_generic.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hds/test_sop.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/quobyte/test_jsonrpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/0a39557c74d66218d06d63d40fd453a7382a775c', 'message': "Fix slow unit tests

As of liberty.2, the Manila unit tests are taking ~60 seconds to run
on my system. A dozen or so of the tests consistently take an integral
number of seconds to run (i.e. 1, 2, 3 or 4 seconds), indicating the
presence of a time.sleep() call in the code that hasn't been mocked.
By mocking time.sleep() and time.time() in just a few files, the time
needed to run the unit tests falls by a third to ~40 seconds (!).

Change-Id: I66a6d864823b10a4193eadf65a1c5d3028f2afa7
Closes-bug: 1478644
"}]
commit_message:
Fix slow unit tests

As of liberty.2, the Manila unit tests are taking ~60 seconds to run
on my system. A dozen or so of the tests consistently take an integral
number of seconds to run (i.e. 1, 2, 3 or 4 seconds), indicating the
presence of a time.sleep() call in the code that hasn't been mocked.
By mocking time.sleep() and time.time() in just a few files, the time
needed to run the unit tests falls by a third to ~40 seconds (!).

Change-Id: I66a6d864823b10a4193eadf65a1c5d3028f2afa7
Closes-bug: 1478644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/52/206652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time self.mock_object(time, 'sleep')

commit_message:
Keep alarm other attrs constantly after evaluating an alarm

When evaluating a threshold alarm, the alarm rule of the *alarm* object
will be changed, because in the _statistics() method, the
alarm.rule['query'] is referenced and extended. When the alarm being
refreshed, the *alarm* object will be updated to db in _refresh()
method, that will cause the alarm's query definition being extended
repeatedly.

Change-Id: Iefb4646ee9d07a272550f13a91ae60220032e4db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/32/205732/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy query = copy.deepcopy(alarm.rule['query'])

commit_message:
MongoDB cluster strategy missing create_admin_user

The strategy's guestagent does not have a cast for the create_admin_user
command. This is needed during cluster create.

Change-Id: Ied11fd0cc9b031b7f671ea8f92463e353b7fc360
Closes-bug: #1476355
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/62/203762/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_admin_user(self, password): LOG.debug("Creating admin user") return self._call("create_admin_user", guest_api.AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT, self.version_cap, password=password)

subject: Mitigates job_status dict change during iteration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 16:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks/services_checks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/0835957a9cf466687b9c3acfd7310db7ddeb3ab6', 'message': 'Mitigates job_status dict change during iteration

If job_status changed during iteration, _clean queried on keys no longer in the dictionary
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/monasca/+bug/1476313
This does not fix this bug, it only mitigates one of the symptoms.
I am not sure that items() is thread safe, but it does reduce the window of time during which problems can occur
  by collecting all values upfront.

Change-Id: Ibe206f45ff308a8b6d04eda28367846105414491
'}]
commit_message:
Mitigates job_status dict change during iteration

If job_status changed during iteration, _clean queried on keys no longer in the dictionary
See https://bugs.launchpad.net/monasca/+bug/1476313
This does not fix this bug, it only mitigates one of the symptoms.
I am not sure that items() is thread safe, but it does reduce the window of time during which problems can occur
  by collecting all values upfront.

Change-Id: Ibe206f45ff308a8b6d04eda28367846105414491

commit_message:
Change incorrect syntax in installation guide

Built: 2015-05-02T13:34:49 00:00
git SHA: 84fad0c54b1ff7f3401adfe3aee4d34158b50d33
URL: http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/install-guide/install/apt/content/keystone-verify.html
source File: file:/home/jenkins/workspace/openstack-manuals-tox-doc-publishdocs/doc/install-guide/section_keystone-verify.xml
xml:id: keystone-verify

openstack --os-auth-url http://openstack-controller:35357 --os-project-name admin --os-username admin --os-auth-type password project list

fails with following error

ERROR: openstack The resource could not be found. (HTTP 404)

bu by changing OS_AUTH_URL, it works
openstack --os-auth-url http://openstack-controller:35357/v2.0 --os-project-name admin --os-username admin --os-auth-type password project list

Change-Id: I084b83f868aa5ee273a81bdb66bc1b52ae4a7037
Closes-Bug: #1451114

commit_message:
libvirt: simplify logic of checking PCI device's existence

Current logic of detecting a PCI device is a little complicated.
Let's switch to use Xpath simplify this.

Partial-Bug: #1407915

Change-Id: I5e4419b6e5461a62d85d192b7b9c7b5d8d853b71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/145400/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: guets_pci_device_config = self._get_guest_pci_device(dev) dom.detachDeviceFlags(guets_pci_device_config.to_xml(), domain='0x' + guets_pci_device_config.domain bus='0x' + guets_pci_device_config.bus slot='0x' + guets_pci_device_config.slot function='0x' + guets_pci_device_config.function xpath = ("./devices/hostdev[@mode='subsystem'][@type='pci']" "[@managed]/source/address[@domain='%s'][@bus='%s']" "[@slot='%s'][@function='%s']") ret = xml_doc.find(xpath % (domain, bus, slot, function)) if ret is not None: raise exception.PciDeviceDetachFailed(reason="timeout", dev=dev)
deleted_lines: dom.detachDeviceFlags(self._get_guest_pci_device(dev).to_xml(), guest_config = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() guest_config.parse_dom(xml_doc) for hdev in [d for d in guest_config.devices if isinstance(d, vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevPCI)]: hdbsf = [hdev.domain, hdev.bus, hdev.slot, hdev.function] dbsf = pci_utils.parse_address(dev['address']) if [int(x, 16) for x in hdbsf] ==\ [int(x, 16) for x in dbsf]: raise exception.PciDeviceDetachFailed(reason= "timeout", dev=dev)

commit_message:
Spec for the OpenStack Documentation Contributor Guide

Change-Id: Ibfa21c006fb5ab3355e05180173af216200f0fb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/76/197976/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= OpenStack Documentation Contributor Guide ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/docs-contributor-guide Problem description =================== Based on the docs contributors experience and feedback, the information for the documentation contributors located on wiki sometimes contains outdated info and can be improved by restructuring and supplementation. As we are treating our documentation as the code and willing others to do so, we need to relocate all the conventions, how to instructions and any docs contributor-related things to the place that fits as a single-entry, full, and neatly organized guide that answers questions that arise in the docs creation workflow. The wiki is definitely not much convenient, it has narrowed functionality and lacks a number of features that have become essential part of any internet user nowadays, such as search, proper navigation, and some others. Moving things around will noways influence its openness to the community or make the conventions less flexible. This will only unify and simplify the process. Proposed change =============== We propose to initiate the creation of the Documentation Contributors Guide targeted at the contributors to the OpenStack documentation that will cover the following issues: * Markup conventions * Terminology and writing syntax conventions * Screenshots and topologies conventions * Documentation structure * Gerrit workflow (HowTo) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Olga Gusarenko <ogusarenko> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- #. Revise based on wiki content. #. Move the cleaned up content to another location (to discuss). #. Add the content that's missing from the 'I-am-a-contributor' perspective. Testing ======= TODO: needs discussion References ========== TODO: #. Add the future team meeting links #. Add to links to the detailed plan of the content relocation

commit_message:
Use oslo.log instead of oslo-incubator logging

log module has been removed from oslo-incubator after oslo.log was
released.

Change-Id: I1cb764c6bd978be71c5a9a6dd26d53ebea5192bb
Implements: blueprint port-oslo-incubator-to-oslo-log

commit_message:
Use oslo.log instead of oslo-incubator logging

log module has been removed from oslo-incubator after oslo.log was
released. This change will fail tests till a new guest image is built
with oslo.log in the requirements.txt file. The change
https://review.openstack.org/162676 has been submitted to get a new
guest image.

Implements: blueprint port-oslo-incubator-to-oslo-log
Depends-On: I1cb764c6bd978be71c5a9a6dd26d53ebea5192bb
Change-Id: I753573c14facf5bf916d6deee8c1cd7f112a9f48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/77/162677/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging
deleted_lines: from trove.openstack.common import log as logging

commit_message:
Sync oslo-incubator

This should be the final sync of oslo-incubator pre-Kilo. Detailed
changelist follows.

_i18n.py

ba544bbc switch to oslo_i18n

eventlet_backdoor.py

7cc15017 Change oslo.config to oslo_config
875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
c6863a5c Remove unnecessary import of eventlet

loopingcall.py

875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API

periodic_task.py

7cc15017 Change oslo.config to oslo_config
875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
c9166a2f Allow overriding name for periodic tasks
4abeda60 Separate add_periodic_task from the metaclass __init__

service.py

4dcc8b35 Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher
7cc15017 Change oslo.config to oslo_config
875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
b888c0fa Merge "Added graceful argument on Service.stop method"
492fa4a3 Added graceful argument on Service.stop method
7ec3fab2 Remove extra white space in log message

systemd.py

875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API

threadgroup.py

875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API

versionutils.py

154263ae Add liberty release name to versionutils
fc6f2479 Switch from oslo.config to oslo_config
875eb30d Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API

Other changes are to address the fact that periodic_task no longer
supports the ticks_between_runs argument.

Change-Id: Idf7899ead53c14c32dc343f2249f105e4b053209

commit_message:
Fix missing create user method in "Identity Admin API v2.0 (SUPPORTED)".

Fix the corrupted section between:
- Section title: Users
- API: GET /v2.0/users Get user information by name

Closes-Bug: #1477876

subject: Write post job logs to apache and swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-29 19:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/ff8c21899b47ddbf320bf73122ef9c6caccd3c4c', 'message': "Write post job logs to apache and swift

Currently we don't get generated parent dir indexes for swift uploaded
logs. This is mostly ok for check/gate jobs as we address the log dirs
directly in the path supplied to gerrit and presented to users. For post
jobs we do not do this so rely on something to provide a proper index.
Go back to apache uploaded logs in addition to swift uploaded logs so
that these files will be indexed until we can set up indexing with
swift.

Change-Id: I7f688834e0d3ad91b81dcbde7643a4b5c208748e
"}]
commit_message:
Write post job logs to apache and swift

Currently we don't get generated parent dir indexes for swift uploaded
logs. This is mostly ok for check/gate jobs as we address the log dirs
directly in the path supplied to gerrit and presented to users. For post
jobs we do not do this so rely on something to provide a proper index.
Go back to apache uploaded logs in addition to swift uploaded logs so
that these files will be indexed until we can set up indexing with
swift.

Change-Id: I7f688834e0d3ad91b81dcbde7643a4b5c208748e

commit_message:
Create a repository for stackforge/xstatic-roboto-fontface

Roboto is the font for Google's Material Design.

We plan on using this in Horizon to provide a theme that
implements Google's Material Design.  This patch creates
a repo for it.

Change-Id: I1977536d0d60a14577b51721432083670d4d46df

commit_message:
Rakefile: create a task to copy logs

When running beaker with Jenkins, it's useful to get the logs at the end
of the job, so we can easily debug eventual failures.

This patch aims to create a Rake task to copy the logs. For that, we
need to make sure WORKSPACE is set (automatically done when running the
job on a Jenkins node). This task will copy the Keystone logs in the workspace.

To run the task, you need to run `rake copy_logs` which is what
OpenStack Infra is doing.

Change-Id: I54550cbce7eb1eb0189e29481649aeb2525c8130
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/12/199712/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Prepare logs directory if acceptance is running unless ENV['WORKSPACE'].empty? on host, "ls -s /var/log/keystone $WORKSPACE/logs" endé

There was only one backend.creating several thinly provisioned volumes in one minute ,if the size of Volume was larger than host's free_capacity_gb, the volume creating maybe failed.

commit_message:
Publish capabilities after volume creation successful

Create several thin provisioned volumes within one minute,
if one volume size is larger than host's free_capacity_gb and
smaller than free_virtual, this creation will be successful,
but the next volume creation will be failed. Publishing service
capabilities after volume creation successful, this bug will
be fixed.

Change-Id: Id3e195d414056c6baeb2afc263d52c7af6290749
Closes-Bug: #1445398

commit_message:
Adds parameter specification for #call()

Adds 1st parameter specification to #call method so that
 1) $dict(key) will not lead to attempt to call dict
 2) it would be possible to implement custom #call versions
     (for example to make $dict(key) possible)

Change-Id: I10eb17b6fa2718b90beceecc84e2ccb2e7eb420d

commit_message:
Python 3 compatibility bug

dict.iteritems() instead of six.iteritems() was used which is not
Py3 compatible

Change-Id: Id916e09ae02a7bfef2e50b63268e4523d9bb2254

subject: Fixes bug with positional arg specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-26 13:03:22.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/language/specs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/yaql/commit/f0d5ada554d95d9f3bed8fbddefd2823bd8d5622', 'message': "Fixes bug with positional arg specs

When function has *args parameter it is always the last positional
argument. In yaql it is possible to declare parameters by their
position rather than by the name. But for *args position number

commit_message:
Fixes bug with positional arg specs

When function has *args parameter it is always the last positional
argument. In yaql it is possible to declare parameters by their
position rather than by the name. But for *args position number
it didn't worked as expected

Change-Id: I9e2fdb135ea51a9604cb0d3a6ba96f3aaf556d7a

commit_message:
Clarify the purpose of the spec backlog

Change-Id: I46e9e07bf89852540c5394e82c92f709a397e596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/77/205277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Nova spec backlog is a place for the team to record decisions about technical problems and proposed solutions. A backlog spec should contain at least a clear problem description, as well as a general description of the proposed or desired solution. This serves as a marker to record the team's acceptance of a problem as in-scope for the project, as well as a reasonable direction for solving the problem. A spec that exists here is something that either needs a driver or implementor, or something that can't be done currently. If you would like to implement one of these specifications, fill out the missing sections and follow the standard process of submitting it to a release (See :doc:`../../readme`).
deleted_lines: If you have a problem that needs solving, but you are not currently planning on implementing it, this is the place we can store your ideas. These specifications have the problem description completed, but all other sections are optional. If you are looking for a blueprint to work on, here is a list of specifications that are looking for owners. If you would like to implement one of these specifications, fill out the missing sections and follow the standard process of submitting it to a release (See :doc:`../../readme`).

commit_message:
Create a repository for stackforge/xstatic-mdi

MDI provides Google's Material Design Icons in SCSS format
We plan on using this in Horizon to provide a theme that
implements Google's Material Design.  This patch creates
a repo for it.

Change-Id: Icab5c5c20b60d95d0ed6ba089558c9dea0051e9f

commit_message:
add E006: check for lines longer than 79 columns

This mimics the widely accepted convention from PEP8 and many other
places that lines longer than 79 columns can not only cause problems
when reading/writing code, but also often indicate a bad smell,
e.g. too many levels of indentation due to overly complex functions
which require refactoring into smaller chunks.

Change-Id: Ic2532676e46e93f129d590d1fa7a044ef65f50fb

commit_message:
Add constraint of IntegerType maximum for API

Currently, the Ceilometer API has no constraint of maximum of int
type. That will cause error when a python unlimited int num
converted to C int type(as the bug described).

This change adds constraint of IntegerType maximum for API, including
period and evaluation_periods fields of alarm threshold_rule, and
search_offset query field.

Change-Id: If9afa1ce8ef31f45e80ef19b26e199c69b5ec26e
Closes-bug: #1315819
DocImpact

commit_message:
Fix Keystone Auth and Tests

Keystone Auth was previously non-functional as the Keystone
API resource being used does not support Roles as required
by the function to map to Anchor Groups.

This was further compounded by the required HTTP return code
being 200 (OK), but the function with POST returns a 201
(CREATED).

This change, switches to to using a GET Keystone API
resource to validate the token passed in by the user.

The keystone unit tests have been updated to a real sample
JSON response from the resource called (rather than the
bogus one previously used) and split up the 3 current tests
into separate functions.

However, long term I really think we will want to switch to
using keystonemiddleware library - rather than our homebrew
usage.

Change-Id: I7b8d81764934638040120bcefe81d012748007c8
Closes-Bug: #1478532
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

commit_message:
Add ability for GET path to see/select alternate frag archs

Changes include:
- storage nodes reporting when they have >1 fragment archive
available
- GET path recognizing alternates, when to use them and building
up the getters accordingly
- GET path assuring that even if it has enough FA's that they
all come from the same set (via etag) and if not try GETs from
the parity nodes to see if they have some more.  This addresses
the case where a simple overwrite PUT happens with a node off
and a subsequent GET comes in while its back but before it gets
updated with the latest stuff.
- associated test changes for existing code
- new unit tests and new probe tests

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1457691
Change-Id: I2491edaa56dcf4eb9e864bbf263be8fa588d64c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/83/201283/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.node = None # sometimes the GET path may request a specific FI by adding # a frag_index key to the node dict, pass it on if so... if 'frag_index' in node: self.backend_headers['X-Backend-Preferred-Frag-Index'] = \ node['frag_index'] self.node = node

commit_message:
Retry ipmi commands unless the failure is not retriable

Consider that image deployment is a time-consuming operation, most
ipmi failures worth retrying, even when BMC is temporarily offline.
List keywords of error messages in configuration file, ipmi command
will be retried if runtime error message does not match keywords.

Change-Id: I444ec23a40bc044117699315c4d3257414a9d85b
Closes-Bug: 1474953
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/51/202751/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.ListOpt('non_retriable_errors', default=['core dumped'], help=_('Define non-retriable errors. Consider that image' 'deployment is a time-consuming operation, most ipmi' 'failures worth retrying, even when BMC is temporarily' 'offline. List keywords of error messages in' 'configuration file, ipmi command will be retried' 'if runtime error message does not match keywords'))
